cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles north of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW, then turning northwest toward the Florida peninsula, likely moving up the peninsula and into south-central Georgia early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches extend north of Jupiter Inlet to Sebastian Inlet and north of Bonita Beach to Anna Maria Island (central-east and central-west Florida coasts).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings from Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and the Bahamas; Storm-surge warning Jupiter Inlet southward to Bonita Beach.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, especially from the Keys northward through northeast Florida, and continuing into coastal Georgia and South Carolina.
weather_observation.wind: High confidence of sustained tropical-storm force winds (34–50 kt) with a 44% chance of sustained ≥50 kt and a 21–22% chance of hurricane-force (64 kt) winds late Sunday through Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge values are not yet specified for Jacksonville, but Irma’s large wind field and onshore flow during closest approach could push 3–6 ft of water above ground level along the St. Johns River and adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 3–6 inches with isolated pockets up to 10 inches across northeast Florida, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large breakers, dangerous rip currents, possible tornadoes in rainbands, and debris-flow hazards for low-lying port infrastructure.
